Article Title: Lionel Messi scores as record crowd witnesses Inter Miami's victory over Sporting Kansas City
Article Text:
(With inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: A staggering 72,610 fans packed Arrowhead Stadium to witness Inter Miami 's thrilling 3-2 victory over Sporting Kansas City . The match, which saw Lionel Messi shine, marked a significant milestone for the city's soccer scene.Lionel Messi, the main attraction behind the relocation of the match from Sporting's usual home stadium to Arrowhead, played a pivotal role in Miami's triumph.The global football icon showcased his brilliance with a goal and an assist, captivating the massive crowd with his performance.Miami took a 2-1 lead in the 51st minute when Messi unleashed a powerful strike from long range, finding the upper-right corner of the SKC net. However, Sporting quickly responded as Erik Thommy netted his second goal of the night in the 58th minute, leveling the score.The decisive moment arrived in the 71st minute when a mistake by Sporting KC allowed Miami's Diego Gomez to set up Luis Suarez for the winning goal, securing the victory for the visitors.Sporting had opened the scoring in the sixth minute through Thommy's clinical finish, but Miami swiftly equalized in the 18th minute courtesy of a well-taken goal by Gomez, set up by Messi.The match showcased moments of brilliance from both sides, with Messi coming close to adding to his tally with a threatening free-kick in the 41st minute. Sporting also had their chances, with Willy Agada testing Miami's goalkeeper Drake Callender.The record-breaking crowd at Arrowhead Stadium surpassed the previous attendance record set in 2010 when the then-Kansas City Wizards faced Manchester United in an exhibition match.
Article Summary: A staggering 72,610 fans packed Arrowhead Stadium to witness Inter Miami's thrilling 3-2 victory over Sporting Kansas City. The match, which saw Lionel Messi shine, marked a significant milestone for the city's soccer scene. Messi, the main attraction behind the relocation of the match from Sporting's usual home stadium to Arrowhead, played a pivotal role in Miami's triumph.

Article Title: La Liga round-up: Real Madrid clinch hard-fought win against Mallorca; Atletico Madrid thump Girona
Article Text:
(Inputs from AP)

NEW DELHI: Real Madrid clinched a hard-fought 1-0 win against Mallorca in the Spanish league on Saturday, resting key players ahead of their crucial Champions League game against Manchester City . Midfielder Aurélien Tchouaméni 's strike three minutes into the second half proved decisive, maintaining Madrid's commanding lead in the league.The victory on the Mediterranean island extended Madrid's lead in the league to 11 points, setting the stage for a crucial clash with Manchester City on Wednesday.Tchouaméni, who will miss the game in England due to suspension, emphasized Madrid's determination despite fatigue from their previous encounter with City."We have a very important game Wednesday," said Tchouaméni. "We played a very difficult game against City and we are tired, but we know that when we play for Madrid we have to give it our all until the end."Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti made strategic substitutions in the second half, with Vinicius Júnior and Eduardo Camavinga making crucial contributions. Dani Carvajal also joined the action in the final minutes, while key players like Rodrygo and Toni Kroos remained on the bench.Tchouaméni's long-range strike, which deflected off a defender, was the only breakthrough Madrid managed against a resilient Mallorca defense. Despite the victory, Madrid faces a tough test against Manchester City in the Champions League quarterfinal, followed by a pivotal La Liga clash against Barcelona.Ancelotti's milestone 183rd league game coached for Madrid draws him level with Zinedine Zidane, second only to Miguel Muñoz's record 424 league games.In another fixture, Atletico Madrid secured a vital 3-1 victory over Girona, with Antoine Griezmann scoring twice to boost their top-four aspirations. Atletico's victory places them in contention for Champions League qualification, while Girona's fourth-minute lead was short-lived as Atletico staged a remarkable comeback.With crucial Champions League fixtures on the horizon, both Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid will aim to maintain their momentum and secure their spots in European football 's elite competition next season.
Article Summary: Real Madrid beat Mallorca 1-0 to extend lead in Spanish league to 11 points. Aurélien Tchouaméni scored only goal of the game in the second half. Atletico Madrid beat Girona 3-1 to boost top-four aspirations.

Article Title: Bayern Munich secure 2-0 win in Bundesliga ahead of Champions League clash against Arsenal
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Bayern Munich emerged victorious with a 2-0 win over Cologne on Saturday, aiming to regain momentum ahead of their Champions League return leg against Arsenal. Despite recent league setbacks, Bayern showcased resilience, but suffered a major blow with winger Kingsley Coman sidelined due to injury.With Bayer Leverkusen poised to secure the Bundesliga title, Bayern's focus has shifted to the Champions League following their draw with Arsenal in the first leg.However, their hopes were dampened as Coman sustained an adductor muscle injury, ruling him out for several weeks.Bayern coach Thomas Tuchel expressed disappointment over Coman's injury, stating, "The injury of Kingsley is extremely bitter with him starting a game today after a very long time. It looked extremely painful... It's a big blow for us."Despite the setback, Bayern remains second in the Bundesliga with 63 points, with VfB Stuttgart joining them after a 3-0 win over Eintracht Frankfurt. Meanwhile, RB Leipzig secured a 3-0 victory over VfL Wolfsburg, maintaining fourth place ahead of Borussia Dortmund.In their match against Cologne, Bayern dominated from the start, creating numerous scoring opportunities in the first half. However, it was Raphael Guerreiro's superb curling shot in the 65th minute that broke the deadlock, putting Bayern ahead.A late save from goalkeeper Sven Ulreich preserved Bayern's lead before Thomas Mueller capitalized on a defensive error in stoppage time to seal the win.Despite the victory, Bayern's joy was tempered by Coman's injury setback. The club confirmed that the French winger would be sidelined for several weeks, dealing a blow to their Champions League aspirations.As Bayern prepare for their crucial clash with Arsenal, they will need to regroup and overcome the absence of Coman to keep their European dreams alive. With the Bundesliga title out of reach, Bayern's focus shifts entirely to their pursuit of Champions League glory.
Article Summary: Bayern Munich beat Cologne 2-0 in their Bundesliga clash on Saturday. Kingsley Coman sustained an adductor muscle injury, ruling him out for several weeks. Despite the setback, Bayern remains second in the Bundesliga with 63 points. VfB Stuttgart joined them after a 3-0 win over Eintracht Frankfurt.

Article Title: Joao Felix's bicycle kick seals narrow win for depleted Barcelona against Cadiz
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Joao Felix 's breathtaking bicycle kick propelled a depleted Barcelona to a hard-fought 1-0 victory over relegation-threatened Cadiz on Saturday.Barca manager Xavi Hernandez opted to rest key players ahead of their upcoming Champions League quarter-final against Paris Saint-Germain , a move that paid dividends as Felix's stunning strike secured three vital points.Barcelona now sit on 70 points, trailing leaders Real Madrid by eight points, setting the stage for an intense " El Clasico " showdown at the Santiago Bernabeu next weekend.Despite missing several regular starters, Barca showcased their depth and determination to secure a crucial win in the title race.The match saw Barcelona dominate the early proceedings, with Felix seizing the opportunity to showcase his exceptional talent. The Portuguese forward capitalized on a rebound from a corner in the 37th minute, executing a mesmerizing volley to break the deadlock and secure the win for his side.Reflecting on his sensational goal, Felix expressed his delight, stating, "I guess this stadium gives me luck. It wasn't planned, I just reacted and it happened. What a great feeling it was and even better with a win this time."Despite Cadiz's valiant efforts to salvage a point, Barcelona's resilient defense, led by goalkeeper Marc Andre ter Stegen, held firm. Ter Stegen's crucial saves frustrated Cadiz's attacking endeavors, preserving Barcelona's slender lead and securing their sixth consecutive victory in all competitions.With Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid also securing wins while resting key players, Xavi's decision to rotate the squad proved crucial in maintaining Barcelona's momentum. Despite missing star players such as Robert Lewandowski and Ilkay Gundogan, Barcelona's depth and determination shone through, extending their unbeaten run to 13 competitive matches.With crucial fixtures on the horizon, including the eagerly anticipated clash against PSG, Barcelona will look to build on this momentum and continue their pursuit of silverware on multiple fronts.
Article Summary: Joao Felix scores stunning bicycle kick as Barcelona beat Cadiz 1-0. Xavi rested key players ahead of Champions League quarter-final against PSG. Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid also secured wins while resting key players. Barcelona now sit on 70 points, trailing Real Madrid by eight points.

Article Title: Juventus' Serie A title hopes dashed in goalless stalemate against Torino
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Juventus' aspirations of clinching the Italian Serie A title were shattered after a disappointing 0-0 draw against city rivals Torino on Saturday. The draw leaves Juventus in third place in the standings with 63 points from 32 games, trailing league leaders Inter by a daunting 19 points.Once dominant in Italian football , Juventus clinched the Serie A title an astonishing nine times in a row from 2012 to 2020.However, the club has struggled to reclaim the trophy since then, facing stiff competition from their rivals.Speaking after the match, Juventus coach Massimiliano Allegri acknowledged the disappointment of not securing a victory but accepted the single point gained. "It's a point... we accept it," Allegri stated during a news conference. "There's always the disappointment of not having scored three, but if we hadn't lost (more) games we would have been in a better place. Today we take it, we have to improve things."Juventus' struggles away from home continued as they remained winless on the road since late January. Despite dominating possession and creating several opportunities, Juventus failed to find the back of the net against a resilient Torino side.The match saw Dusan Vlahovic squander two golden opportunities in the first half, with one effort striking the post and another testing Torino goalkeeper Vanja Milinkovic-Savic. Torino, meanwhile, thought they had taken the lead early in the second half, only for Duvan Zapata's goal to be disallowed for a foul in the buildup.As Torino pressed for a winner, Juventus goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny was called into action, making a crucial save to deny Antonio Sanabria's header. Despite a late scare when Szczesny required treatment after a collision, Juventus held on for the draw.The result ended Juventus' impressive streak of scoring away goals against Torino, highlighting the difficulties they faced in breaking down their resilient opponents.Looking ahead, Juventus face a challenging fixture against 14th-placed Cagliari before hosting second-placed AC Milan in their bid to salvage their season. Meanwhile, Torino, sitting in ninth place with 45 points, continue to impress defensively, boasting the most Serie A clean sheets at home this season with 11.
Article Summary: Juventus held to a 0-0 draw by city rivals Torino on Saturday. The draw leaves Juventus in third place in the Serie A standings. The result ends Juventus' impressive streak of scoring away goals against Torino. Juventus face a challenging fixture against 14th-placed Cagliari.

Article Title: Guardiola five years ahead of other coaches, says Bayern great Pizarro
Article Text:
(Watch Bundesliga 2023-24 live on Sony Sports Ten 5 SD & HD)

MUMBAI: Claudio Pizarro may have played alongside Xabi Alonso at Bayern Munich for just one season, but it was enough for the former Peru striker to be certain of what Alonso was planning to do once his playing days were over."I know him really well," Pizarro, who is visiting India for the first time as a Bayern ambassador, told TOI on Saturday. "We played together at Bayern (2014-15 season).You could see at that time when we were playing that he was going to be a coach."The way he was analysing the games and talking about what we have done in a game, things like that. He always said that he wanted to do it, and I'm really happy for him that he's doing so well in the Bundesliga ."Not just the Bundesliga, mind you! While Alonso's Bayer Leverkusen would be crowned German champions for the very first time with a win at home against Werder Bremen on Sunday, they are on course to script something even more historic.Having gone 42 matches (37 wins, 5 draws) without tasting defeat once across the three competitions they are competing in this season, Leverkusen are on track to become the first side to complete a record unbeaten season for a top-five European league team."When you achieve something like that in one season, to play so many games and not lose any, it is something special. I hope that he will continue growing in his coaching career, maybe at Bayern Munich at some point," Pizarro added with a laugh.For a while, there was strong speculation that Alonso, one of the most sought-after football coaches in Europe, would indeed succeed Thomas Tuchel at Bayern. Was that laugh then a hint that Pizarro possibly tried swaying his old teammate? "No I didn't," the 45-year-old Bayern great smiled. "I just congratulated him for all that he is doing."Everybody thought he was going to come. But he talked to the people at Leverkusen and decided to stay. It's his decision and we have to respect it."For a player who scored over 100 goals for both Bayern and Werder Bremen, Pizarro also waxed lyrical about current Bayern striker Harry Kane , even if he had sympathy for the England captain who left Tottenham last season seeking to win major trophies, only to see Bayern's 11-year reign as German champions set to end."I think it is not that easy for him at this point. He came here of course to win titles, but on the other hand, what he has done this year, scoring so many goals, it is something special," said Pizarro, underlining Kane's work-rate. "He's not just standing in the box and scoring goals. He's working on the whole pitch."I hope of course the next season, he could win some titles with Bayern. We are still in one (competition), could be possible we could get the Champions League at the end."There's still a long way from that happening. But as Premier League leaders Arsenal discovered during the first leg of their Uefa Champions League quarterfinal in London, which ended in a 2-2 draw, for all Bayern's domestic struggles, the six-time European champions remain a genuine threat on the continental front."Before the game against Arsenal, everybody was a bit worried and skeptical about what Bayern could do, because the games that they played in the Bundesliga before that were not that good," Pizarro, the sixth highest scorer in Bundesliga history (197 goals in 490 matches), said. "But you can see when it's a Champions League game, in these moments, you can see what Bayern Munich are. They played a very good game and have now got in a good situation to qualify for the next round."Pizarro knows the feeling of being a Champions League winner, having won the competition in 2013 during his second spell at Bayern which saw the Bavarian giants clinch the treble. The following season, Pep Guardiola would arrive at the Allianz Arena, allowing the Peruvian the distinction of being among the few footballers to have played under both Jose Mourinho and Guardiola, something else he shares in common with Alonso.Which of the two iconic managers left a bigger impression on him then?"Both left a good impression on me. I worked just three months with Jose Mourinho because he then got sacked," Pizarro said of the unexpected twist to the start of his spell at Chelsea in 2007. "At the beginning I was playing a lot and I could talk to him a lot. He was a great coach. He would talk very well with the players."With Pep, I had the chance to work two years, to know him very well, to know what he's capable of doing in a team, his tactics. I always say that Pep could be five years in front of the other coaches. He analysed the games very intensely. And he knew exactly what player to use for what game and in every situation. He is a very special coach."Ask Bayern and Werder Bremen fans and they'll tell you - Pizarro was a very special player!
Article Summary: Claudio Pizarro played alongside Xabi Alonso at Bayern Munich for just one season. The former Peruvian striker is visiting India for the first time as a Bayern ambassador. Alonso's Bayer Leverkusen would be crowned German champions for the very first time on Sunday.

Article Title: ISL: NorthEast United hand Odisha FC humiliating 3-0 defeat
Article Text: KOLKATA: The stakes were higher for Odisha FC going into Saturday’s Indian Super League ( ISL ) clash in Guwahati. But in search of gaining some lost momentum going into the all-important playoffs, the Juggernauts suffered another rude jolt while hosts NorthEast United restored their pride in the last outing of the season with a clinical 3-0 win at Indira Gandhi Athletic Stadium .Parthib Gogoi, Nestor Albiach and Phalguni Singh scored one apiece inside the first 45 minutes to make it a memorable night for the Highlanders, who finished best among the ones finishing outside the top-six with playoff spots.Odisha, fighting for the League Shield only a couple of weeks ago, looked a shadow of their dominant self at the Highlanders’ home. Sergio Lobera , suspended for the match, could do nothing but look at his wards’ performance from the stands in disbelief. Resting some of their first-team players in the starting XI and taking the overseas trio of Roy Krishna , Ahmed Jahouh and Mortada Fall off at the half-time, the Kalinga Warriors were lacklustre throughout the 90 minutes to say the least.It looks like the long break due to the FIFA international window could not soothe their nerves following their AFC Cup Inter-zonal two-leg semifinal defeat to Central Coast Mariners about a month ago.In the 12th minute, Gogoi brought up a poacher’s goal from a fast counter-attack to give the hosts a deserving lead. The young Assamese striker placed his left-footed shot from centre of the box at bottom left corner following an assist by winger Jithin MS from left.Before the Kalinga Warriors could regroup, NorthEast doubled the lead four minutes later through Albiach’s clinical finish. Upon receiving a through from Gogoi outside the area, the Spanish attacking midfielder first forced centre-back Thoiba Moirangthem to be wrong footed near the centre of the box and then rounded off an onrushing Odisha goalkeeper Lalthuammawia Ralte before placing home a slow right-footed grounder near right post.Odisha, despite enjoying a larger share of possession, failed to convert that into meaningful forays into the opponents’ area. Their first real chance of reducing the margin went begging in the 25th minute when Krishna failed to convert from the spot. It was Krishna’s first penalty miss in ISL. The Fijian striker has converted from all his previous 10 spot kicks in the country’s top-tier league.Odisha winger Pranjal Bhumij had earned the penalty when he was brought down inside the box. But the former Bengaluru FC forward’s weak, low kick didn’t have enough power to beat NEUFC goalkeeper Mirshad Michu to his right.With nothing going in their favour on the night, the Juggernauts suffered another setback on the cusp of half-time when Phalguni wrote his name on the scoresheet three minutes into the first-half stoppage time.Phalguni was at the right place at the right time when Gogoi’s cross from right found him running at the centre of the box. With Odisha centre-back Fall towering over him, the diminutive Manipuri midfielder shook the net with his right-footed shot at the top right corner to send the Highlanders Brigade into a frenzy.
Article Summary: Parthib Gogoi, Nestor Albiach and Phalguni Singh scored one apiece inside the first 45 minutes to make it a memorable night for the Highlanders. Sergio Lobera could do nothing but look at his wards’ performance from the stands in disbelief.

Article Title: Manchester City hammer Luton 5-1 to move top of the Premier League
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

Manchester City showcased their dominance in the Premier League with a commanding 5-1 victory over relegation-threatened Luton Town, propelling them to the top of the table in a fiercely contested title race.Erling Haaland continued his prolific goal-scoring form, notching his 20th league goal of the season to lead City to victory. Pep Guardiola 's side displayed their attacking prowess right from the start, with Jeremy Doku opening the scoring within 70 seconds after his shot deflected off Daiki Hashioka's face and into the net, setting the tone for City's relentless onslaught.Despite Luton Town's resilient defensive efforts, City's relentless pressure eventually paid off, with Mateo Kovacic finding the back of the net with a sublime strike from the edge of the box in the 64th minute.Haaland further extended City's lead with a well-converted penalty in the 76th minute, showcasing his clinical finishing ability once again. Although Ross Barkley managed to pull one back for Luton Town, City quickly reasserted their dominance, with Doku adding to the scoreline with a dazzling dribble and finish.Josko Gvardiol completed the rout for City with a goal seconds before the final whistle, sealing a comprehensive victory for Guardiola's men. With an impressive 73.7% possession and a staggering 37 shots on goal, City's dominance was evident throughout the match as they asserted their authority at the top of the Premier League table.As the title race heats up, City's convincing performance against Luton Town sends a strong message to their rivals, underlining their credentials as serious contenders for the Premier League title this season.With six games remaining, Guardiola's side will be determined to maintain their momentum and secure another league crown."Today was always going to be very difficult... I don't want to sound defeatist, but almost made peace with it at the beginning," Luton manager Rob Edwards said. "We stayed in the game as long as we could."I'm proud of the lads, they gave everything. No one likes losing 5-1, but (City) are a brilliant football team. They suffocated us. It was a long day for us today."Arsenal host Aston Villa on Sunday and Liverpool host Crystal Palace.City have no time to rest on their laurels as they host Real Madrid in the second leg of their Champions League quarter-final on Wednesday. The teams drew 3-3 in the opening leg. They then head to Wembley on Saturday for an FA Cup semi-final against Chelsea.
Article Summary: Manchester City beat Luton Town 5-1 to go top of the Premier League. Jeremy Doku, Mateo Kovacic, Erling Haaland and Josko Gvardiol scored for City. Pep Guardiola's side have six games remaining in the season. Arsenal host Aston Villa on Sunday and Liverpool host Crystal Palace.

Article Title: Newcastle hit Tottenham for four to enliven Champions League race
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

Newcastle United surged into the Premier League 's top six with a resounding 4-0 victory over Tottenham Hotspur, reigniting their outside hopes of securing a place in next season's Champions League . Alexander Isak starred with a brace as the Magpies delivered a dominant performance at St. James' Park.The result saw Spurs' lead over Newcastle reduced to 10 points with six games remaining, raising the possibility of a late charge by the Magpies, who have a more favorable run-in.Eddie Howe 's side faced defensive challenges due to injuries, prompting a switch to a back three formation. However, Tottenham struggled to capitalize on the home side's makeshift defense, with Newcastle largely untroubled after an early bright start by the visitors.The tide turned decisively in Newcastle's favor with two quickfire goals midway through the first half, both stemming from errors by Spurs' Micky van de Ven. Isak capitalized on these mistakes to open the scoring before Anthony Gordon doubled the lead moments later.Isak extended Newcastle's advantage early in the second half, further asserting his influence on the match. The Swedish striker's performance saw him move within striking distance of the Premier League's Golden Boot race, trailing Erling Haaland by just two goals.Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou responded to his side's lackluster display by making tactical substitutions, including withdrawing captain Son Heung-min. The visitors' woes were compounded by an injury to right-back Pedro Porro.The defeat dealt a blow to Tottenham's aspirations of securing a Champions League spot, particularly with the top-four race intensifying amid English clubs' struggles in European competitions. Spurs slipped behind Aston Villa on goal difference, with challenging fixtures against Arsenal, Liverpool, and Manchester City still to come.Postecoglou had warned of the toll of European football on squads, citing Newcastle's struggles as an example. However, Newcastle's strong performance underscores their potential to mount a late surge for a top-four finish, with Fabian Schar sealing the victory with a late header from a Gordon corner.As the Premier League season enters its decisive phase, Newcastle's emphatic win injects renewed optimism into their campaign, while Spurs are left to regroup and refocus on their remaining fixtures.
Article Summary: Newcastle United beat Tottenham Hotspur 4-0 at St. James' Park. Alexander Isak scored a brace, with Anthony Gordon and Fabian Schar also on target. Result sees Spurs' lead reduced to 10 points with six games remaining.

Article Title: 'Not great', admits Novak Djokovic as 2024 slump continues
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

Novak Djokovic candidly admitted to a challenging season following his loss to Casper Ruud in the Monte Carlo Masters semi-finals.The 10th-ranked Norwegian secured his first victory against the world number one in six attempts with a 6-4, 1-6, 6-4 triumph.Despite the setback, Djokovic remains composed, assuring that he won't succumb to panic despite missing out on a chance to secure his 41st Masters title, particularly against an opponent he previously defeated in the French Open final last year."There are positives to take away for sure, but I'm used to a really high standard in terms of expectations and results," said 36-year-old Djokovic."Not having a title is -- compared to the last 15 years -- not a great season at all."Djokovic's participation in only four events this season has been noted, yet he anticipates intensifying his schedule as he transitions to the upcoming clay court events in Madrid and Rome, followed by the prestigious Roland Garros .His decision to skip Miami after an unexpected defeat to 123rd-ranked Luca Nardi at the Indian Wells Masterspreceded his appearance in Monte Carlo."I had a semis in Australia, the semis here. It's normal to expect that you have some seasons where you don't start well - this is the one," he added."Hopefully, I can pick up. In terms of results, I can build from here."I've played some good tennis. Hopefully, in the next tournaments I'll be able to play even better."Ruud will face Stefanos Tsitsipas in Sunday's title match in Monte Carlo after the Greek beat Australian Open champion and world number two Jannik Sinner in his semi-final
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic lost to Casper Ruud in the Monte Carlo Masters semi-finals. The 10th-ranked Norwegian secured his first victory against the world number one in six attempts. Ruud will face Stefanos Tsitsipas in Sunday's title match after the Greek beat Jannik Sinner.

Article Title: Casper Ruud upsets Novak Djokovic, will face Tsitsipas in Monte Carlo final
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

Casper Ruud delivered a stunning upset at the Monte Carlo Masters , overcoming top seed Novak Djokovic 6-4, 1-6, 6-4 in a thrilling semi-final clash to advance to the title match.Ruud's victory avenged his loss to Djokovic in last year's French Open final, setting up a highly-anticipated showdown with two-time champion Stefanos Tsitsipas .In a rollercoaster encounter, Ruud seized an early advantage by breaking Djokovic's serve twice in the opening set.Despite facing a formidable opponent in Djokovic, the Norwegian remained composed and held his nerve to claim the first set.Djokovic responded emphatically in the second set, showcasing his champion's mentality by storming back to level the match. However, Ruud remained undaunted, demonstrating his resilience and determination to stay in contention.As the match entered the decisive third set, Ruud capitalised on Djokovic's unforced errors to secure an early break and seize control of the proceedings. Maintaining his composure under pressure, Ruud maintained his advantage to close out the victory and book his place in the final.Ruud's triumph marked a significant milestone in his career, ending his five-match losing streak against Djokovic and announcing his arrival as a force to be reckoned with on theATP Tour .With his impressive performance against the world number one, Ruud showcased his potential to compete at the highest level and contend for prestigious titles.As he prepares to face Tsitsipas in the title match, Ruud will draw confidence from his hard-fought victory over Djokovic and aim to continue his impressive run at the Monte Carlo Masters. With both players vying for glory, the stage is set for an enthralling final showdown between two formidable competitors."This is a day I will remember for a long time. Beating a world number one is something I have never done," Ruud said in a post-match interview."You know how good these guys are under pressure... he saved so many break points. I was praying, please, let it be a double fault or something. And maybe someone was listening."This year's Australian Open winner Sinner made a comeback in the second set after losing the first to Tsitsipas. He led 4-3 in the decider when leg cramps forced him to take a medical timeout.The 22-year-old Italian continued but proved no match for Tsitsipas who won the next three games to clinch victory."It was tennis at the highest level that I have been able to play," Tsitsipas said."He is one of the toughest opponents I have faced so far... to find a way when there were not many, I am extremely proud of that."The win over Sinner brought Tsitsipas back into the top 10 of the world rankings after dropping out for the first time since 2019 earlier this year.
Article Summary: Casper Ruud beats Novak Djokovic in Monte Carlo Masters semi-final. Ruud will face Stefanos Tsitsipas in the title match. The Norwegian avenged his French Open final loss to the world No.1. The 22-year-old Italian defeated Australian Open winner Sinner.

Article Title: Stefanos Tsitsipas knocks out Jannik Sinner to reach Monte-Carlo final
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

Stefanos Tsitsipas , the two-time champion of the Monte-Carlo Masters , delivered a stunning performance to overcome second seed Jannik Sinner 6-4, 3-6, 6-4 and secure a spot in the final. In a thrilling encounter, the 25-year-old Greek displayed resilience and composure to outlast his opponent in a hard-fought contest.After a commanding display in the opening set, Tsitsipas faced a formidable challenge as Sinner mounted a spirited comeback to claim the second set.However, Tsitsipas remained unfazed, demonstrating his mental fortitude as he weathered the storm and stayed composed under pressure.As Sinner gained momentum and surged ahead to a 4-3 lead in the decider, the match took a dramatic turn when the Italian suffered an injury to his right leg, prompting a medical timeout. Despite his efforts to continue, Sinner struggled to match Tsitsipas' level as the Greek star seized control of the match."It was tennis at the highest level that I have been able to play," Tsitsipas said after the match."He is one of the toughest opponents I have faced so far... to find a way when there were not many, I am extremely proud of that."Sinner had been enjoying an exceptional run of form in 2024, claiming titles at the Australian Open, Rotterdam Open, and Miami Open, with his only defeat in 23 matches coming against Carlos Alcaraz in the semi-finals of the Indian Wells last month.His impressive performances had solidified his reputation as one of the rising stars in men's tennis, showcasing his talent and potential on the global stage.With an 11-6 win-loss record for the year, Sinner entered the contest against Stefanos Tsitsipas as a formidable opponent, backed by his recent successes and confidence on the court.However, Tsitsipas' victory over the red-hot Italian not only marked a significant achievement for the Greek player but also highlighted his ability to rise to the occasion against top competition.For Tsitsipas, the win against Sinner held added significance as it propelled him back into the top 10 rankings, a position he had momentarily relinquished earlier in the year.Tsitsipas will either face top seed Novak Djokovic or Norwegian Casper Ruud, who play in the semis later on Saturday.
Article Summary: Stefanos Tsitsipas beats Jannik Sinner to reach Monte-Carlo Masters final. Greek star will face either Novak Djokovic or Casper Ruud in the final. Sinner had been enjoying an exceptional run of form, claiming titles at the Australian Open, Rotterdam Open, and Miami Open.

Article Title: Rafael Nadal to make long-awaited ATP return next week in Barcelona
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Rafael Nadal is set to make his eagerly awaited return to ATP competition at the Barcelona Open next week, marking his first official tournament appearance since January.The 22-time Grand Slam champion's comeback follows a hiatus prompted by a hip injury flare-up during his quarter-final defeat in the Brisbane Open.Nadal, who will turn 38 in June, aims for a smooth return to action as he gears up for a shot at securing a record-extending 15th French Open title, scheduled from May 20 to June 9.His participation adds excitement to the Barcelona Open, where he has enjoyed immense success in the past.The tournament's anticipation is further heightened by the comeback of Nadal's compatriot Carlos Alcaraz , the world No.3, who missed the Monte Carlo Masters due to a right arm injury.While Nadal receives a wild card invitation, Alcaraz, the two-time defending Barcelona champion, benefits from a first-round bye as a seeded player.Nadal's draw presents a potentially challenging path, starting with a matchup against Flavio Cobolli, ranked 63rd, who is 16 years younger. A victory could set up a showdown with the formidable Australian Alex De Minaur in the second round.The prospect of a semi-final clash with Alcaraz, on the court now bearing Nadal's name due to his 12 tournament victories, adds to the tournament's allure.A video release showcasing Nadal's training session, where he appeared to move with ease and soundly defeated Russia's Andrey Rublev , further fuels anticipation for his return.Having missed most of the 2023 season due to injury, Nadal is keen to maximize his clay court preparation time for the French Open, particularly considering the potential significance of this being his last year on tour.With his sights set on further glory, Nadal's comeback is eagerly awaited by fans and tennis enthusiasts alike.
Article Summary: Rafael Nadal is set to make his eagerly awaited return to ATP competition at the Barcelona Open. The 22-time Grand Slam champion's comeback follows a hiatus prompted by a hip injury flare-up during his quarter-final defeat in the Brisbane Open.

Article Title: India lose 1-2 to New Zealand, miss out on historic play-off berth in Billie Jean King Cup
Article Text:
(With PTI inputs)

NEW DELHI: India's hopes for a historic play-off berth in the Billie Jean King Cup were dashed as they succumbed to a 1-2 defeat against New Zealand in Changsha, China on Saturday.Ankita Raina faced a challenging task in the crucial second singles match and later suffered a setback in the decisive doubles encounter alongside partner Prarthana Thombare .Despite Rutuja Bhosale 's commendable effort, securing a lead for India with her victory over Monique Barry in the opening singles, Raina faced an uphill battle against world number 169 Lulu Sun.Unfortunately, Raina was unable to overcome her opponent's dominance, falling short with a scoreline of 2-6, 0-6. A win in this pivotal match would have secured India a spot in the play-offs for the first time in history.With the fate of the tie hanging on the doubles match, Raina and Thombare couldn't deliver the desired result, conceding the contest to Paige Hourigan and Erin Routliffe with a score of 1-6, 5-7.Despite their best efforts, India ultimately finished third in the six-team Group I, ensuring their participation at the same level in the competition next year.While the loss may be disappointing for the Indian team, their competitive spirit and determination will undoubtedly fuel their aspirations for success in future editions of the tournament.
Article Summary: India's hopes for a historic play-off berth in the Billie Jean King Cup were dashed as they succumbed to a 1-2 defeat against New Zealand. India ultimately finished third in the six-team Group I, ensuring their participation at the same level in the competition next year.

Article Title: Novak Djokovic into record 77th Masters semi-final at Monte Carlo
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Novak Djokovic secured his record 77th Masters semi-final by defeating Alex de Minaur in straight sets in Monte Carlo on Friday.The 36-year-old world number one navigated through a challenging quarter-final, clinching victory with a scoreline of 7-5, 6-4. This marks his first appearance in the last-four in the principality since 2015, the year he clinched his second title at the tournament.Djokovic is set to face either Casper Ruud of Norway or France's Ugo Humbert in the quest for a spot in Sunday's final."It was tough for both of us. He is one of the quickest players on tour. He gets a lot of balls back that normally 99 percent of other players don't," said Djokovic who avenged his loss to De Minaur at the United Cup in January."He did not surprise me with several passing shots. Particularly in the second set when I was up a break."But he said at the net it was ugly. The second set I think it was. We didn't play at the high level and made a lot of unforced errors, him and I, and a lot of breaks of serve. It is kind of expected on clay but maybe not this many. But a win is a win and I am happy to be through."Saturday's other semi-final sees Australian Open champion and world number two Jannik Sinner face two-time Monte Carlo winner Stefanos Tsitsipas.In-form Sinner took his 2024 record to 25 wins and just one loss with a gruelling 6-4, 6-7 (6/8), 6-3 victory over 2023 runner-up Holger Rune.Greek 12th seed Tsitsipas breezed past Karen Khachanov of Russia 6-4, 6-2.Djokovic had appeared on course for a comfortable afternoon under the sweltering Riviera sun against 11th seeded De Minaur.After pocketing the first set, he was quickly 2-0 ahead in the second.However, five successive breaks of serve followed as the top seed saw leads of 3-1 and 4-2 retrieved by his opponent who clawed back to 4-4.Djokovic held for 5-4 and secured his fifth break of the match in the 10th game to claim victory to move two wins away from a 41st career Masters title.
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic beats Alex de Minaur 7-5, 6-4 to reach Monte Carlo Masters semi- final. World number one will face either Casper Ruud of Norway or France's Ugo Humbert. Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner faces Stefanos Tsitsipas in other semi.

Article Title: Jannik Sinner sets up Monte Carlo semi with two-time winner Stefanos Tsitsipas
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Stefanos Tsitsipas of Greece advanced to the semi-finals of the Monte Carlo Masters , keeping his quest for a third title alive with a commanding performance against Russia's Karen Khachanov .Tsitsipas, a former winner of the tournament in 2021 and 2022, showcased his prowess by defeating Khachanov 6-4, 6-2 in a match that lasted just 81 minutes.This victory marked Tsitsipas's eighth win in nine encounters against Khachanov, who struggled to find his rhythm during the match.In the semi-finals, Tsitsipas is set to face off against Jannik Sinner , the reigning Australian Open champion. Sinner, the Italian player, secured his spot in the semi-finals by overcoming a challenge from Holger Rune of Denmark.Despite dropping a tight second set, Sinner bounced back to claim victory with a scoreline of 6-4, 6-7 (6/8), 6-3, avenging his defeat in last year's semi-finals.The upcoming clash between Tsitsipas and Sinner promises to be an exciting encounter, as both players vie for a spot in the final of the prestigious Monte Carlo Masters tournament.Tsitsipas was delighted with his performance."I was very effective from the start, I had a lot of pace and gained momentum," said Tsitsipas."I tried to do my part and press and it worked out really well."Khachanov had cheekily said to the umpire prior to the match "Are you going to stay focussed?" to which the official replied "Always, of course."The match saw Karen Khachanov struggling to find his usual form, especially considering his strong performance in the previous match against compatriot Daniil Medvedev.The opening exchanges were marked by a lack of consistency from both players, resulting in three consecutive breaks of serve. However, Tsitsipas managed to break the pattern and take a 3-1 lead.Khachanov showed glimpses of his abilities, demonstrating a mix of power hitting, delicate touch, and agility as he won a service game to narrow the gap to 3-2.However, he faced challenges, particularly when he required medical attention for an upper quad injury at 5-4 down. Despite returning to the court, Tsitsipas managed to serve out the set.In the second set, Khachanov continued to struggle, facing pressure on his serve at 1-1. Although he saved a break point and held serve, a series of errors led to Tsitsipas securing the crucial break at 3-2. Frustration boiled over for Khachanov, who expressed his displeasure by angrily flinging his racket to the ground.Tsitsipas capitalized on the momentum, winning 11 consecutive points to surge to a commanding 5-2 lead. With his opponent visibly frustrated, Tsitsipas closed out the match comfortably, securing his spot in the quarter-finals with a strong performance.He admitted the tournament brought out the best in him though it is yet to lead to him winning the big one on clay, The French Open."I would lie if I said it did not bring out the best in me," he said grinning."There are many good memories and stepping out here and coming back here it revives those good memories."It brings me alive."In contrast to Tsitsipas's easy ride, Sinner had a marathon battle in overcoming Rune in 2 hours 40 minutes to record his 25th win in 26 matches this year.Rune revelling in his bad boy reputation riled the crowd and the umpire in the second set making a gesture at the spectators when they booed him.He was given a second warning by the umpire whereupon Rune sat down in his seat and demanded the supervisor.He resumed playing and showed his brilliance in storming back from 6-4 down in the tie-break to win it 8-6.However, Sinner also showed his resilience in winning three successive games from 3-3 to secure his place in the last four."It is never easy to play Holger so I am happy to have won, but above all to be able to raise my level of game a little," said Sinner."This match was a very physical one, lots of long rallies."As for Rune's behaviour Sinner said he had been warned after similar rumblings in the 2023 semi-finals."One can try and create a little bit of chaos," said Sinner."That is no problem. I learned from last year."That is all part of the learning process. If I had lost today, I would have learned more lessons."
Article Summary: Stefanos Tsitsipas beats Karen Khachanov 6-4, 6-2 to reach the semi-finals of Monte Carlo Masters. The Greek will face reigning Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner in the last four. Sinner defeated Holger Rune of Denmark in a marathon match in 2 hours 40 minutes.
